title: Justin 2014 Isosceles Red (Paso Robles)
description: This flagship bottling is still a whopper of a wine. This vintage, a blend of 73% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Cabernet Franc and 12% Merlot, offers barely ripe black cherry, green peppercorn and charred fennel on the nose. The palate is loaded with both savory and ripe flavors, from roasted black plums and charred beef to oregano and dill. Very complex and chalky in texture.

title: Ken Wright 2015 Abbott Claim Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Firm and focused, this young wine has miles to go. It opens with bright raspberry and cherry fruit, then puts on bulk in the midpalate, adding lovely orange-peel highlights. Drinking well this young, it has the structure and depth to add many more layers over the next decade or longer. Drink now through 2030 and beyond.

title: Ken Wright 2015 Hirschy Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: There is a certain high-toned intensity to many of Ken Wright's 2015s, which amps up the young fruit. Here the dominant flavors are ripe strawberry, vivid and layered against firm ripe tannins. There's a touch of coffee and dark chocolate running through the finish. For reasons unknown, this new cuvée bears the old Ken Wright label design.

title: La Perla Marco Triacca 2012 La Mossa  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: This radiant savory mountain Nebbiolo opens with enticing scents of wild berry, flint, smoke and a whiff of alpine herb. It's elegant and focused, delivering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside taut refined tannins and bright acidity. It's already tempting but will develop even more complexity over the next several years or more. Drink 2020–2032.

title: Le Marchesine 2009 Secolo Novo Riserva Dosage Zero  (Franciacorta)
description: Enticing scents of yellow stone fruit, acacia and brioche show this wine's Chardonnay pedigree. A refined beading and tangy acidity lend elegance and balance to flavors of creamy yellow pear, apple and lemon. A hint of fennel graces the finish.

title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Abtsberg Superior Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)
description: Concentrated tangerine and candied lemon-peel flavors are juxtaposed by complexities of savory earth and smoked nuts. While off dry and sprightly, there's a lusciousness that builds on the midpalate that extends into a long, lavishly fruity finish.

title: MCV 2015 1105 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and dark in the glass, this Petite Sirah-dominant blend offers aromas of pure blackberry jam on the nose with hints of dried wild fennel and charred plum. It's rich and dense on the palate, but vivacious with fresh black-fruit energy and lifted by clove and purple-flower flavors. The acidity is bright, and tannins are firm but set in the background.

title: Mullineux 2015 Granite Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
description: A stunning wine, this opens with scents of golden straw, honeydew rind, firm nectarine and fresh honeycomb that all carry through to the medium-weight mouth. The palate boasts a flinty, mineral texture and bright acidity that lends verve and precision to the notes of toasted apple, spiced orange rind and pressed yellow flowers. Hints of fresh herbs and minty fynbos grace the enduring finish. It sure is delicious now, but try this stunner from 2020–2028.

title: Nera 2011  Sforzato di Valtellina
description: Aromas suggesting steeped prune, dark culinary spice, new leather, tobacco and balsamic notes lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the firmly structured palate along with raisin and licorice, while tightly knit fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provide the austere framework. A smoky mineral note lingers on the finish. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Quinta de la Rosa 2015 Tim Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This new release, a limited production wine from this estate, is named after Tim Bergqvist, the patriarch of the family that owns this property. The wood aging has given richness, almost creamy sweetness to the ripe fruits. The attractive slight oxidation adds complexity to what is already a fine wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Vintage  (Port)
description: Almost black in color, this rich, unctuous wine at first seems smooth. Ripe black-plum and jammy berry fruits are ripe and dense. Behind that generous exterior, firm tannins and a dense structure will allow the wine to age well. Drink after 2026.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

title: Trinchero 2014 BRV Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is richly layered, offering a density of brick, toasty char and dusty rock flavors and aromas—a muscular showing from a warm vintage. Black pepper, leather and dried herbs provide additional complexity around a full-bodied core.

title: Wicks 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: This wine is already showing characteristics of age, but in all the best ways. This offers heady aromas of dried flowers, cinnamon bark, beef stir fry and sumac yet the palate is full of savory, sinewy tannins and a tonic character, ending on a long, dried cherry finish. It's easy to fall under this wine's spell.

title: Wrath 2015 115/667 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Lots of herbs, dried red currants and cranberry compote aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which has an earthy, gamy undercurrent. The palate tastes like it has more age on it, which is a good thing for now, with flavors of charred wood, damp forest floor, dried fruit and allspice, all riding a squeaky texture.

title: Château Latour 2014 Les Forts de Latour  (Pauillac)
description: Packed with the fruit of the vintage, this wine is bright and crisp. Its acidity and pure black-currant flavors are delicious, juicy, the tannins now sitting easily in the background. The wine, which comes from a specific parcel, is developing well and will be released after 2020. It should be drunk from 2023.

title: Château Preuillac 2015  Médoc
description: The wine, with its rich tannins and fruit, comes from this impressively restored estate run by the Mau family. Already packed with black fruits and juicy acidity, it has the structure and concentration to age well. Drink from 2024.

title: Bonfadini NV Carpe Diem Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Tangy, savory and elegant, this bright, silky sparkler offers inviting aromas and flavors of Golden Delicious apple, tangy tangerine drop, white peach, mineral and herb. A creamy mousse lends even more finesse while cream-filled brioche lingers on the finish.

title: Bosio 2009 Girolamo Bosio Riserva Pas Dosé  (Franciacorta)
description: Vibrant and delicious, this structured sparkler opens with heady scents of ripe orchard fruit and baked bread. The intense palate delivers Rennet apple, tangerine zest, chopped herb and a hint of toasted almond alongside bright acidity and an elegant perlage. It finishes juicy and bone dry.

title: Château Fonroque 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This biodynamic estate has produced a rich, dense and generous wine, with solid yet fine tannins and powerful, pure black-fruit flavors. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Lécuyer 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This small-quantity, 500-case production wine is rich and dense in ripe tannins that power through the generous black-currant fruit. It is a dark, concentrated wine that will age well; don't drink before 2024.

title: Château Branas Grand Poujeaux 2017 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Dense and concentrated, this wine has great richness, spice, sweet tannins and layers of opulent black fruits. It will be ready to drink relatively soon, so enjoy from 2022.

title: Château Margaux 2017 Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is crisp, full of black currants and with attractive acidity as well as a firm texture. It is cool and classic, with a light touch of wood and tannin. It's likely to be ready from 2023.
designation: Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux Barrel Sample

title: Château la Louvière 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Dark and dense, this wine has an impressive structure behind concentrated blackberry flavors. It is rich, full and with a fine future. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Margaux 2017 Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. With delicious crispness, this wine is tense and nervy, with a strong mineral texture. It is already well balanced, with citrus fruits that are hit with spice as well as a hint of wood. Drink from 2020.
designation: Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux Barrel Sample

title: Château Fonbadet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Dense with layers of black currant, this is a fine wine that is full of opulent tannins and rich fruit. Ample acidity cuts through the richness expressing the freshness of the vintage. Drink from 2023.

title: Château la Couspaude 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. A dense wine that is full of tannins as well as black currant fruit, this is solid and concentrated. It has a dark, firm character, with fine aging potential. It is a well-balanced wine with good aging potential; drink from 2023.

title: Château Larcis Ducasse 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is fruity, soft and rounded. With attractive acidity and some firm tannins in the background, it has enough structure to allow it to age. The core of the wine is dry with a ripe surround. Drink from 2023.

title: Château la Dominique 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is initially closed, only allowing the fruit to show more strongly as it develops in the glass. However, there is fruit here along with some firm tannins. The aftertaste is juicy and fruity.

title: Château Troplong Mondot 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine has the bold fruit that is the hallmark of this estate. It is a generous wine, packed with soft fruit flavors and light tannins, suggesting a wine that will age relatively quickly. Drink this ripe wine from 2023.

title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2017 Barrel Sample Le Petit Haut Lafitte  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. With its broad structure and rich tannins, this is a dense wine. It has a line of fine acidity that comes through the dryness at the core. Dark and concentrated at the end, the wine is going to need some time. Drink from 2023.
designation: Barrel Sample Le Petit Haut Lafitte
